longDef.en: a set of connected things or devices that operate together
a set of computer equipment and programs used together for a particular purpose

examples.en: The system keeps crashing and no one is able to figure out why.
examples.cn: 系统老是崩溃，谁也不知道是为什么。

longDef.en: a set of organs or structures in the body that have a particular purpose
the way that the body works, especially the way that it digests food and passes out waste products
longDef.cn: 人体的活动方式（尤指消化和排泄方式）

examples.en: A run in the morning is good for the system - it wakes the body up and gets everything going.
examples.cn: 晨跑对身体很好——它能唤醒整个身体，使各个部分运转起来。

examples.en: We'll have to develop a better filing system.
examples.cn: 我们必须设计出一套适当的归档方法。

examples.en: Under this system, many people were prevented from voting.
examples.cn: 在这一体制下，很多人无法投票。

examples.en: The legal system operates very differently in the US and Britain.
examples.cn: 美国和英国的法制体系相去甚远。

longDef.en: a particular method of counting, measuring, or weighing things

examples.en: the metric system of measuring and weighing

longDef.en: the intentional and organized use of a system

examples.en: There doesn't seem to be any system to the books on these shelves - they're certainly not in alphabetical order.
examples.cn: 这些架子上的书摆放得似乎没有任何条理——它们肯定不是按字母顺序放置的。

longDef.en: unfair laws and rules that prevent people from being able to improve their situation
longDef.cn: （不公平的）法律规定，现行体制，现有制度

examples.en: He has his own ways of beating the system, making sure that he has good relationships with influential people.
examples.cn: 他对付当前的制度自有一套办法，就是和有权有势的人搞好关系。
